alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 11 at 6:00PM CDT until June 11 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Marshall County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 559 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located near Oketo, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. At 554 PM, a trained spotter reported a tornado 6 miles west northwest of Oketo. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Marysville and Oketo. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
